title: üç≥ Kitchen & Gazebo Setup (Days 8-10)
goal: Establish a functional cooking and food prep area with shelter from sun and rain, near water and storage areas for convenience.

materials.name: Compost bin / bucket for organic waste

steps.title: Select Kitchen Location
steps.description: Choose a flat area close to water source and storage container. Ensure drainage and some natural shade if possible.

steps.title: Assemble Gazebo Frame
steps.description: Follow manufacturer instructions to assemble metal frame. Use extra stakes or ropes to secure against wind.

steps.title: Attach Tarpaulin Cover
steps.description: Stretch tarpaulin over frame tightly. Ensure corners are anchored with ropes and pegs. Leave slight slope for rainwater runoff.

steps.title: Set Up Cooking Station
steps.description: Place stove / gas burner on stable surface. Keep fire extinguisher nearby. Ensure ventilation for smoke and gas safety.

steps.title: Install Prep & Storage Areas
steps.description: Set metal table for cutting and prep. Place crates or shelves for dry food storage, cooking utensils, and cleaning materials.

steps.title: Set Up Waste Management
steps.description: Position compost bin near kitchen but away from tents. Clearly mark bins for organic and non-organic waste.

steps.title: Test and Organize
steps.description: Test stove for stability and ventilation. Arrange utensils and storage for easy access. Verify rainwater flows away from kitchen area.

tips.content: üí° Use ropes and extra pegs to prevent gazebo lifting during Beaufort West winds.
üí° Store fuel away from cooking area in metal containers.
üí° Keep a small bucket of water nearby as extra fire safety measure.
üí° Consider hanging shade cloth on sides if wind carries dust or sand.

safety: Ensure stove is on level surface to avoid tipping.
Keep flammable materials away from burner.
Use gloves when handling hot surfaces or tarpaulin.
Install fire extinguisher and know its operation.
